summary:
The Spanish Civil War was a conflict between Spain's left-wing Republican government and right-wing Nationalists. The Republicans had support from socialists and communists, while Nationalists were led by General Francisco Franco and backed by conservatives and monarchists. The war started when Nationalist generals tried to overthrow the government.

Italy and Germany helped the Nationalists, while the Soviet Union and Mexico aided the Republicans. Many international volunteers joined the fight. The Nationalists won, controlling Spain until Franco's death in 1975. The war was known for its brutality and political divisions.
title: Spanish Civil War
